definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
(onom.) patter, splatter, click/to smack one's lips/to pull (on a pipe)

sentences.english: The children pattered down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們嗒嗒地跑下樓梯。

sentences.english: The children pattered down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們嗒嗒地跑下樓梯。

sentences.english: The rain rattled on the roof all night, which kept me awake.
sentences.chinese: 整夜雨打屋頂嗒嗒作響，弄得我無法入睡。

sentences.english: The rain rattled on the roof all night, which kept me awake.
sentences.chinese: 整夜雨打屋頂嗒嗒作響，弄得我無法入睡。

sentences.english: I heard the typewriter clacking in the next office.
sentences.chinese: 我聽見隔壁辦公室中打字機發出嗒嗒的聲音。

sentences.english: I heard the typewriter clacking in the next office.
sentences.chinese: 我聽見隔壁辦公室中打字機發出嗒嗒的聲音。

sentences.english: There was a rattle of rifle-fire.
sentences.chinese: 傳來一陣步槍發出的嗒嗒聲。

sentences.english: There was a rattle of rifle-fire.
sentences.chinese: 傳來一陣步槍發出的嗒嗒聲。

sentences.english: A rider came pounding up with an order from the commander in chief.
sentences.chinese: 一個騎着馬的人帶着總司令的命令嗒嗒地飛奔而來。

sentences.english: A rider came pounding up with an order from the commander in chief.
sentences.chinese: 一個騎着馬的人帶着總司令的命令嗒嗒地飛奔而來。

sentences.english: The typewriter was rattling away so loudly that we could not fall asleep.
sentences.chinese: 打字機嗒嗒地響個不停，吵得人不能入睡。

sentences.english: The typewriter was rattling away so loudly that we could not fall asleep.
sentences.chinese: 打字機嗒嗒地響個不停，吵得人不能入睡。

sentences.english: She tapped on the table with the pencil .
sentences.chinese: 她用鉛筆嗒嗒嗒地敲着桌子。

sentences.english: She tapped on the table with the pencil .
sentences.chinese: 她用鉛筆嗒嗒嗒地敲着桌子。

sentences.english: She tapped on the table with the pencil .
sentences.chinese: 她用鉛筆嗒嗒嗒地敲着桌子。

sentences.english: Sometimes, I like standing at the window, looking at the patterning rain.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，我則站在窗旁，望窗外嘀嘀嗒嗒的雨點。

definition: denote a sound or sharp noise (gunfire etc)
phonetic a, similar to 呵/-azine, see 吖嗪[a1 qin2]
(onom.) expressing admiration or surprise/sound of a laugh
(onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
(onom.) to squeak (of mice)/to chirp or peep (of small birds)
(interjection expressing surprise, grief etc)/variant of 嘻[xi1]
(onom.) sound of dripping water, a ticking clock etc
